lead_paragraph: GRANT--Alfred D.,M.D. The NYU Hospital for Joint Diseases Department of Orthopaedic Surgery mourns the passing of our esteemed colleague and friend Dr. Alfred D. Grant, Clinical Professor of Orthopedic Surgery at the NYU School of Medicine. Dr. Grant was an important part of the Hospital for Joint Diseases for over 55 years. During many of these years, he held important clinical leadership positions that enhanced the name and reputation of the Division of Pediatric Orthopaedics, the Department and the Institution. He was a national and international leader in the care of children with orthopaedic and neuromuscular problems. A respected clinician and educator, Dr. Grant contributed to the education of over 300 orthopaedic residents and fellows creating a legacy of patient care that will continue for decades. We send our heartfelt condolences to his wife Ellen, daughters Laura and Michele and his seven grandchildren. Funeral services will take place at Riverside Chapel on Friday, May 27 at 11:30am. His family has requested that donations in Dr. Grant's memory be directed to the Alfred and Ellen Grant Visiting Professorship at NYU Langone Medical Center. Joseph D. Zuckerman, M.D. and Dr. Alfred Grant's colleagues and friends in the NYUHJD Department of Orthopaedic Surgery 1/3
